card1.title: High perishability of products
card1.text: Demand and supply vary greatly throughout the year.

card2.title: Seasonal fluctuations
card2.text: We have our unique system for release planning, development and deployment.

card3.title: Dependence on weather conditions
card3.text: Poor weather can ruin entire crops and delay deliveries.

card4.title: High competition
card4.text: Many flower shops and online sellers make it hard to stand out.

card5.title: Logistical challenges
card5.text: Fast and careful delivery is required to keep flowers fresh.

card1.title: The queen of flowers is the rose

card6.title: The scent of a peony carries the fragrance of a thousand roses.

card7.title: The most sought-after flowers are lilies

card8.title: Sun-faced flowers of success and happiness â€“ gerberas

card1.title: Demand for Eco-Friendly Bouquets Grows by 40%: Customers Embrace Sustainable Trends
card1.text: In 2024, buyers have been increasingly ordering dried flower arrangements and locally sourced seasonal blooms. Florists note that eco-friendly packaging and plastic-free solutions boost customer loyalty.

card2.title: Flower Shops Adopt AI: Chatbots Increase Conversion by 25%
card2.text: Neural networks now help customers choose bouquets based on photos, send reminders for important dates, and handle up to 60% of orders without manager involvement. Pilot projects have already launched in Moscow and St. Petersburg.

card3.title: One-Hour Flower Delivery Becomes the New Industry Standard
card3.text: Flower delivery services are introducing ultra-fast shipping thanks to optimized logistics and micro-warehouses within city limits. Market leaders predict that by 2025, this service will be available even in smaller towns.
